partial_orders.reason: Both edits add identical lines of code (the comment and the ChatMessage put operation) in the same structural location within similar classes. Both are adding the exact same pattern: a comment '# inject new input into memory' followed by 'new_memory.put(ChatMessage(content=task.input, role=MessageRole.USER))'. This represents a bulk-edit pattern where the same code change is being applied to multiple similar classes as part of a single refactoring operation. The changes are structurally identical and target the same type of syntactic construct (method bodies in similar agent worker classes), making this a synchronized pattern substitution.

Edit 0 adds a new ChatMessage to memory in the SelfReflectionAgentWorker.initialize_step method, which increases the chat history length by 1. Edit 1 updates a test assertion to expect the chat history length to be 8 instead of 7, and updates the comment to reflect the additional 'user' message. The test is directly verifying the behavior modified in edit 0 - the addition of the user input message to chat history. These edits reference the same chat_history mechanism and the test assertion directly depends on the implementation change.

Edit 0 adds a new ChatMessage to memory in the ToolInteractiveReflectionAgentWorker.initialize_step method, which increases the chat history length by 1. Edit 1 updates a test assertion that checks the length of agent.chat_history from 7 to 8, and updates the comment to reflect the additional 'user' message. The test is directly verifying the behavior modified in Edit 0 - the addition of the user input message to memory affects the chat history length that the test is asserting. Both edits reference the same underlying chat_history mechanism, where Edit 0 modifies the implementation that affects chat history length, and Edit 1 updates the test expectation for that exact same chat history length.

Both edits perform an identical structural substitution on the same type of syntactic construct (test assertions). They change the expected chat_history length from 7 to 8 and update the comment to reflect the same sequence pattern. The before→after pattern is identical in both cases: single-line assertion becomes multi-line assertion with updated value and comment. This represents a bulk edit pattern where the same fix is being applied to multiple test files as part of a single, contiguous refactor to correct the expected chat history length.
